meanings.definition: Hold the attention of (someone) to the exclusion of all else or so as to transfix them.
meanings.sent1: The magician mesmerised the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent2: The movie mesmerised me with its captivating storyline.
meanings.sent3: The cat mesmerised the laser pointer, thinking it was a bug.
meanings.sent4: The painting mesmerised me, as if the eyes followed me wherever I went.
meanings.sent5: The music mesmerised the crowd, making them sway in unison.

meanings.sent1: The hypnotist mesmerised the volunteer on stage.
meanings.sent2: The mysterious stranger mesmerised the townspeople with his tales.
meanings.sent3: The baby mesmerised the dog by waving a toy in front of its nose.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the night sky mesmerised me, twinkling like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The dancer mesmerised the audience with her graceful movements.
